title: Great Place to Work
pros: I enjoy the freedom I have to try and improve the operations I am responsible for.
cons: None I can think of.

title: You will not be valued nor trained here
pros: The commissions were nice when you got them, and if you had a manager who'd share it with you if you're the assistant
cons: Absolutely no training for any position. They regard it as a "baptism by fire" and I wish I was joking. Corporate and regional managers emotionally beat down their employees All reports about poor management, abuse, and neglect, get emailed to the manager in question to deal with making the workplace feel hostile. 0 work/life balance. You'll be on call 24/7 and have to give everything up at home of an issue arises. If you can't do that- this isn't the job for you

title: Cut Throat
pros: Does everything by the book.
cons: Mid Level Management will micromanage you. You will not be trained. You will be expected to do exactly what Regional Manager says with no questions asked. You will be told you will be supported, but she will back stab you. You will not be given the power to do your job.

title: Fast paced
pros: Solid business plan and fast paced at neighborhood improvements
cons: Not necessarily a clear line of communication from upper management

pros: Good company to work for.
cons: Community Management tolerates to much.

title: STAY AWAY! This company has zero clue what they are doing stay away far away. Dont get yourself hurt.
pros: None even the paycheck wasn't a guarantee
cons: Everything use your own tools for 14 an hr lol wow no.. Cover up black mold the regional manager will have you do so. Everyone is at risk all the time. No safety. No clue how to manage a property. Paid every week lol yea right your check will be late every week so don't count on getting paid.

title: Great Place to Work and Great Mission
pros: People are very accessible. As a team, we help people have quality housing at an affordable price. People notice when your efforts.
cons: Covid has made it so the in-person annual meeting doesn't happen at this moment. That was a great event where everyone was brought together and learned from each other.

title: Grain of Salt
pros: I was outside most the day.
cons: Pay, on call, community manager at the time didnt understand that unforntunately some jobs may appear to be a 20min job may take an hour.

title: Great place to work!
pros: Great regional manager, communication is great, they care about their employees and residents.
cons: Hourly pay could be better, engineers difficult to deal with.

title: Lawn
pros: There is no pros at all
cons: Two faced and it’s all family ,They work when they want to,use company trucks for personal use if your family you get free lot rent and they steal

title: Enjoying the Company

title: Family Company
pros: Everyone feels like family. Most employees stay with the company for a while creating a real family.
cons: There are a lot of changes within the industry to keep up on.

title: OFFICE ASSISTANT
pros: The love of people, helping others, resolve situations, make others comfortable, know they can count on me to be there.
cons: They talk behind folks backs and laugh, lies, not sharing in work don't care about family situations.

title: Great place to work
pros: Great salary and incentive along with seasoned and supportive corporate staff
cons: All the cons that go along with property management

title: Hard work pays off
pros: Great corporate support and fair salary for the amount of work and hours necessary
cons: High stress, long hours, company fails to invest in older properties

title: Lies lies and more lies
pros: None unless you love getting lied to then this is a great place. Plan on hating your job? Apply today!
cons: Promise you promotions and pay increases never deliver. Pays 15.00 an hr though they will tell you 21.00 when they hire . I'd stay away from all locations especially cranberry twp, pa
